reason: Significant regulatory uncertainty surrounds stablecoins and privacy tokens, potentially introducing systemic risks to the broader crypto market, as highlighted by conflicting reports from JPMorgan and local bankers. Geopolitical instability, evidenced by the Trump-Powell feud, further adds to macro volatility. While Bitcoin shows resilience and new adoption pathways via X's integration are positive, the substantial headwinds necessitate a cautious 'WATCH' posture for now.
headlines: Bitcoin rises 1%, Nasdaq futures and dollar drop as Trump-Powell feud escalates
Privacy tokens rally as XMR breaks all-time high
Prediction markets downplay Powell exit risk despite DOJ probe: Asia Morning Briefing
JPMorgan downplays stablecoin threat as local bankers warn of $6.6 trillion risk
Elon Musks's X teases crypto-aware ‘smart cashtags’ just day after community backlash
